title: AARP, Google to Launch Digital Skills Program for Older Workers
sub_head: Program seeks to train low-income people ages 50 and older on skills to help with their careers
body:
Alphabet Inc . ’s Google and AARP want to help older people improve their digital skills.
The AARP Foundation said the new program, aided by a $10 million grant from Google’s philanthropic arm, will aim to train 25,000 people ages 50 and older on helping them use digital skills to advance in their careers.
